attributes.comment:
Dear US Government,

I do understand that the costs related to immigration should be covered by fees
paid by the immigrants, but it should be done in a fair way. One pays for the
administration time used, and not based on assumptions as the proposed rule will
do. For example the elimination for interim benefits such as Advance Parole,
EAD,... will be paid for by all individuals applying for I-485, even if they do not need
to file for these interim benefits. As a result for some the price will jump from $325
to $905 which is a 300% increase instead of the 66% mentioned. Also, not
everyone has to file for an entire family. Some are single.

Why not pay for what you need?
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
